    Dft1d.Double  
    Dft1d.Float  
    Dft1dDirect
    Direct (slow) implementation of the 1-dimensional DFT using tabulated sine and cosine values.
    Dft1dDirect.Double
    One-dimensional DFT implementation using double precision data.
    Dft1dDirect.Float
    One-dimensional DFT implementation using single precision (float) data.
    Dft1dFast
    FFT (fast) implementation of the DFT, based on the JTransforms package by Piotr Wendykier (see https://github.com/wendykierp/JTransforms).
    Dft1dFast.Double
    One-dimensional FFT implementation using double precision data.
    Dft1dFast.Float
    One-dimensional FFT implementation using single precision (float) data.

    DistanceTransform

    InterpolatingThresholder
    This thresholder splits the image into non-overlapping square sub-images, computes the optimal threshold within each sub-image (using an Otsu thresholder) and interpolates linearly between these local thresholds.
    InterpolatingThresholder.Parameters  
    InterpolationMethod

    LucasKanadeForwardMatcher
    Lucas-Kanade (forward-additive) matcher, as described in Simon Baker and Iain Matthews, "Lucas-Kanade 20 Years On: A Unifying Framework: Part 1", CMU-RI-TR-02-16 (2002) Also called the "forward-additive" algorithm.
    LucasKanadeInverseMatcher
    Inverse Compositional Matcher, as described in Simon Baker and Iain Matthews, "Lucas-Kanade 20 Years On: A Unifying Framework: Part 1", CMU-RI-TR-02-16 (2002)
    LucasKanadeMatcher
    This is the common super-class for different variants of the Lucas-Kanade matcher.
    LucasKanadeMatcher.Parameters
    Default parameters for the containing class and its sub-classes; a (usually modified) instance of this class is passed to the constructor of a non-abstract sub-class.

    MaxEntropyThresholder
    Maximum entropy thresholder modeled after Kapur et al.
    MaxLocator_NOTSOOLD
    The common interface for all sub-pixel locators in this package.
    MaxLocator_NOTSOOLD.Method
    Enumeration of keys for MaxLocator_NOTSOOLD methods.
    MaxLocator_NOTSOOLD.QuadraticLeastSquares
    2D interpolator based on least-squares fitting a quadratic polynomial
    f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2 + c_5 xy
    to the supplied sample values.
    MaxLocator_NOTSOOLD.QuadraticTaylor
    2D interpolator using second-order Taylor expansion to fit a quadratic polynomial of the form
    f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2 + c_5 xy
    to the supplied samples values.
    MaxLocator_NOTSOOLD.Quartic
    2D interpolator based on fitting a 'quartic' (i.e., 4th-order) polynomial
    f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2 + c_5 x y + c_6 x^2 y + c_7 x y^2 + c_8 x^2 y^2
    to the supplied sample values.
    MaxLocator_OLD
    The common interface for all sub-pixel locators in this package.
    MaxLocator_OLD.Method
    Enumeration of keys for MaxLocator_OLD methods.
    MaxLocator_OLD.Quadratic1
    2D interpolator based on fitting a quadratic polynomial (axis-parallel paraboloid, with no mixed terms) of the form
    f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2
    to the supplied samples.
    MaxLocator_OLD.Quadratic2
    2D interpolator based on fitting a quadratic polynomial (non-axis-parallel paraboloid, including mixed terms) of the form
    f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2 + c_5 xy
    to the supplied samples.
    MaxLocator_OLD.Quartic
    2D interpolator based on fitting a 'quartic' (i.e., 4th-order) polynomial of the form
    f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2 + c_5 x y + c_6 x^2 y + c_7 x y^2 + c_8 x^2 y^2
    to the supplied samples.

    SubpixelMaxInterpolator
    The common interface for all sub-pixel locators in this package.
    SubpixelMaxInterpolator.Method
    Enumeration of keys for SubpixelMaxInterpolator methods.
    SubpixelMaxInterpolator.QuadraticLeastSquares
    2D interpolator based on least-squares fitting a quadratic polynomial
    f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2 + c_5 xy
    to the supplied sample values.
    SubpixelMaxInterpolator.QuadraticTaylor  
    SubpixelMaxInterpolator.QuadraticTaylorExtra
    2D interpolator using second-order Taylor expansion to fit a quadratic polynomial of the form
    f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2 + c_5 xy
    to the supplied samples values.
    SubpixelMaxInterpolator.Quartic
    2D interpolator based on fitting a 'quartic' (i.e., 4th-order) polynomial
    f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2 + c_5 x y + c_6 x^2 y + c_7 x y^2 + c_8 x^2 y^2
    to the supplied sample values.
